metadata.title: CVE-2022-1475 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An integer overflow vulnerability was found in FFmpeg versions before 4.4.2and before 5.0.1 in g729_parse() in llibavcodec/g729_parser.c whenprocessing a specially crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1475` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libavformat-extra - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libavformat58 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libavutil56 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libswresample3 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libswscale5 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
